benchmark_details.name: FoRepBench (Formula RepairBench mark)
benchmark_details.overview: FoRepBench is a benchmark dataset specifically designed for context-aware Excel formula repair, focusing on runtime errors. It includes spreadsheet context, faulty formulas, corrected versions, and user utterances expressing intent.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a high-quality benchmark for evaluating models that assist in repairing Excel formulas and diagnosing errors.

data.source: Curated seed samples from online forums and generated using a synthetic data generation pipeline.
data.annotation: Manual verification and correction by annotators, supplemented by automated checks.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the ability of the repaired formula to compile and execute without errors.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in Execution Match indicate better performance of the model in repairing formulas.
methodology.baseline_results: Various LLMs including GPT-4o, GPT-4.1, Phi-3, and Mistral were evaluated with varying performance.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated through execution checks and LLM-based semantic validation.
